# Exports jump 34% in January thanks to robust demand for semiconductors

Button LabelListen

Text Size

Print

By **Yonhap**

- PublishedFeb 1, 2026 9:22 amKST
- UpdatedFeb 1, 2026 10:30 amKST

![Containers await shipment at a port in Pyeongtaek, Gyeonggi Province, Jan. 27. Yonhap](https://newsimg.koreatimes.co.kr/2026/02/01/cb447822-ae01-4b0a-bd23-f8a02332f160.jpg?w=728)

Containers await shipment at a port in Pyeongtaek, Gyeonggi Province, Jan. 27. Yonhap

Exports jumped 33.9 percent from a year earlier in January to over $65 billion, driven by strong demand for semiconductors on artificial intelligence servers, government data showed Sunday.

Outbound shipments came to $65.85 billion last month, the highest for any January, according to the data compiled by the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Resources.

It marked the first time Korea's January exports surpassed $600 billion.

Imports gained 11.7 percent on-year to $57.1 billion, resulting in a trade surplus of $8.74 billion. It was the 12th consecutive month the country saw a trade surplus.

The rise in exports was in line with the country's all-time high yearly exports of $709.7 billion in 2025.

Last year, Korea's outbound shipments topped $700 billion for the first time on the back of the strong performance of key export items, such as semiconductors, automobiles and ships.

In January, semiconductor exports reached $20.54 billion, surging 102.7 percent from a year earlier, on a continued increase in memory chip prices fueled by high demand for artificial intelligence (AI) servers.

Car exports climbed 21.7 percent on-year to $6.07 billion last month, thanks to an increase in the number of working days and robust sales of eco-friendly vehicles.

Korea had a larger number of working days in January, as the Lunar New Year holiday is scheduled to fall in February this year, unlike last year, when the traditional holiday took place in J
